description: {"blocks":[{"key":"14sed","text":"T7 Endonuclease I recognizes and cleaves non-perfectly matched DNA. This protocol describes how to determine genome targeting efficiency by digesting annealed PCR products with T7 Endonuclease I. In the first step PCR products are produced from the genomic DNA of cells whose genomes were targeted using Cas9, TALEN, ZFN etc. In the second step, the PCR products are annealed and digested with T7 Endonuclease I. Fragments are analyzed to determine the efficiency of genome targeting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":17}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CAA1F6483DE1450EB22ED35645DD0109","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/m0302-t7-endonuclease-i"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjrlc","text":"Purify the reaction using   according to the manufacturer’s suggestion.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7dvnd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"auf0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"36","guid":"C1545F7085AD11EA9B5087E42B6CB9AA","id":0,"label":"Ampure XP beads","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8nc3g","text":"This step is optional since 1 µl of the reaction will not interfere with analysis on an Agilent Bioanalyzer using DNA1000 reagents.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2kub","text":"Analyze the fragmented PCR products and determine the percent of nuclease-specific cleavage products (fraction cleaved).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27mm7","text":"Calculate the estimated gene modification using the following formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u3gg","text":"% gene modification = 100 x (1 – (1- fraction cleaved)1/2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":54,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
